content:
I'd be happy to help you design a customized swimming workout plan that targets your legs and glutes. Here's a sample plan to get you started:

**Warm-up (10-15 minutes)**

* Easy swimming (freestyle or breaststroke) to get your heart rate up and loosen your muscles
* Leg swings: Hold onto the side of the pool and swing one leg forward and backward, then switch to the other leg
* Glute bridges: Hold onto the side of the pool and lift your hips out of the water, squeezing your glutes at the top

**Leg-Focused Drills (20-25 minutes)**

* **Kicking Drills**:
	+ Kickboard kicks: Hold a kickboard and kick your legs in a flutter kick motion (30 seconds)
	+ Frog kicks: Hold a kickboard and kick your legs in a frog kick motion (30 seconds)
	+ Alternate legs: Hold a kickboard and kick one leg, then switch to the other leg (30 seconds per leg)
* **Leg Lifts**:
	+ Lift one leg out of the water and hold for 5 seconds, then lower back down (10 reps per leg)
	+ Lift both legs out of the water and hold for 5 seconds, then lower back down (10 reps)
* **Whip Kicks**:
	+ Hold a kickboard and perform a whip kick motion with your legs (30 seconds)
	+ Alternate legs: Hold a kickboard and perform a whip kick with one leg, then switch to the other leg (30 seconds per leg)

**Glute-Focused Drills (20-25 minutes)**

* **Glute Kicks**:
	+ Hold a kickboard and lift your hips out of the water, squeezing your glutes (30 seconds)
	+ Alternate legs: Hold a kickboard and lift one leg out of the water, squeezing your glutes, then switch to the other leg (30 seconds per leg)
* **Butterfly Kicks**:
	+ Hold a kickboard and perform a butterfly kick motion with your legs (30 seconds)
	+ Alternate legs: Hold a kickboard and perform a butterfly kick with one leg, then switch to the other leg (30 seconds per leg)
* **Glute Bridges**:
	+ Hold onto the side of the pool and lift your hips out of the water, squeezing your glutes at the top (10 reps)

**Cool-down (5-10 minutes)**

* Easy swimming (freestyle or breaststroke) to gradually bring your heart rate back down
* Static stretches for your legs and glutes, such as hamstring and quadriceps stretches

**Sample Workout Schedule**

* Monday: Leg-Focused Drills (30 minutes)
* Wednesday: Glute-Focused Drills (30 minutes)
* Friday: Leg-Focused Drills (30 minutes)

**Tips and Variations**

* Start with shorter workouts and gradually increase the duration as you build endurance.
* Mix and match drills to create a circuit-style workout.
* Incorporate strength training exercises on land to target your legs and glutes, such as squats, lunges, and deadlifts.
* Adjust the intensity and volume of your workout based on how you feel.
* Focus on proper technique and engage your core muscles to maintain a stable body position in the water.

Remember to listen to your body and adjust the workout plan as needed. It's also essential to incorporate rest days and active recovery to allow your muscles to recover and rebuild. Good luck, and have fun with your swimming workout!
